edu.illinois.library.cantaloupe.cache

Interface Cache

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DerivativeCache, SourceCache

    public interface Cache

    Interface to be implemented by all caches. A cache stores and retrieves unique images corresponding to OperationList objects, as well as ImageInfo objects corresponding to Identifier objects.

    Implementations must be thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanUp()
      Cleans up the cache.
      void purge()
      Deletes the entire cache contents.
      void purgeExpired()
      Deletes expired images and dimensions from the cache.
      void purgeImage(Identifier identifier)
      Deletes all cached content (source image, derivative image(s), and info) corresponding to the image with the given identifier.

    • Method Detail

      • cleanUp

        void cleanUp()
      throws CacheException

        Cleans up the cache.

        This method should not duplicate the behavior of any of the purging-related methods. Other than that, implementations may interpret "clean up" however they wish--ideally, they will not need to do anything at all.

        The frequency with which this method will be called may vary. It may never be called. Implementations should try to keep themselves clean without relying on this method.

        Throws:
        CacheException

      • purge

        void purge()
    throws CacheException
        Deletes the entire cache contents.
        Throws:
        CacheException - Upon fatal error. Implementations should do the best they can to complete the operation and swallow and log non-fatal errors.

      • purgeExpired

        void purgeExpired()
           throws CacheException
        Deletes expired images and dimensions from the cache.
        Throws:
        CacheException - Upon fatal error. Implementations should do the best they can to complete the operation and swallow and log non-fatal errors.

      • purgeImage

        void purgeImage(Identifier identifier)
         throws CacheException
        Deletes all cached content (source image, derivative image(s), and info) corresponding to the image with the given identifier.
        Parameters:
        identifier -
        Throws:
        CacheException - Upon fatal error. Implementations should do the best they can to complete the operation and swallow and log non-fatal errors.
